question: 躍如
sourceMnemonic:
A <kanji>leap</kanji> of <kanji>likeness</kanji> is when something that's not real takes a big leap towards the likeness to reality. This happens when something is <vocabulary>vividly depicted</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>clearly expressed</vocabulary>.

This word is generally used in the phrase <ja>面目躍如たる</ja>, which functions as an adjective to exemplify someone’s honor.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
